com.saic.uicds.core.em.endpoint

Class TaskingServiceEndpoint

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.saic.uicds.core.em.endpoint.TaskingServiceEndpoint
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.saic.uicds.core.infrastructure.util.ServiceNamespaces

    @Endpoint
@Transactional
public class TaskingServiceEndpoint
extends Object
implements com.saic.uicds.core.infrastructure.util.ServiceNamespaces
    The Tasking Service allows a client to create, update, query and delete a list of tasks for a resource. The resource to be tasked must be represented by an identifier of a resource instance. Each resource instance in the UICDS system can have a list of tasks for a given incident as a work product associated with the incident. Task lists are managed as a whole. There are service end points for the basic creation, retrieval, update and deletion of task lists. A UICDS TaskList contains the following information:
    • entityId - the resource instance identifier the task list is assigned to
    • task list - a list of tasks containing
      • taskId - the task identifier
      • description - the task description
      • priority - the numeric task priority
      • assignedTo - to whom the task is assigned
      • assignedBy - who assigned the task
      • status - the current task status including numeric completion indicator and text comment
      • dueDate - a datetime value

    The TaskType is defined as the following data structure:

    The Tasking Service manages UICDS work products of type "Tasking".

    Author:
    Ron Ridgely
    See Also:
    Appendix: TaskingService.wsdl, Appendix: TaskingService.xsd
